description.narrative: A package of knowledge products, skills and tools is available to ensure equitable access to quality maternal, neonatal and child health services, including emergency obstetric and newborn care (EmONC)., which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Child Health, Health Systems Strengthening, Maternal And Newborn Health. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, Pregnant women, newborn and under five children have equitable access to essential health care services and tuberculosis and malaria are prevented and controlled

sector.narrative: Facility based maternal and newborn care (including emergency obstetric and newborn care, quality improvement)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: A package of knowledge products, skills and tools is available to ensure equitable access to quality maternal, neonatal and child health services, including emergency obstetric and newborn care (EmONC).

description.narrative: As of June 2020, the number of UNICEF supported health facilities offering delivery services with functional newborn resuscitation and the number of convergent county hospitals equipped with necessary equipment to provide Comprehensive emergency obstetric care services remains unchanged from the 2019 (9 in total) due to a reprioritization of Emergency Obstetric and Neonatal Care (EmONC) in the 2020 Work plan as a result of the COVID-19 Pandemic. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/08/2020

title.narrative: Number of county hospitals equipped with necessary equipment to provide Comprehensive emergency obstetric care services
Percentage of UNICEF supported health facilities offering delivery services with functional newborn resuscitation equipment (functional bag and mask in neonatal size)
Number UNICEF supported health facilities equipped to provide Basic EmONC services
